summary: Yvonne W. Briggs was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available are certification reports and payroll certifications listing her position, annual salary, and pay period earnings. These documents span from May to November 1978, indicating her employment with the HSCA during that period. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but they confirm her status as a paid employee.
significance: Yvonne W. Briggs' significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll and certification reports indicates she was part of the team involved in the investigation.
